name: Profile
description: The Profile class is the client-side implementation of JsMacros profile management for Minecraft. It extends BaseProfile with Minecraft-specific functionality including in-game error display, chat integration, client event registration, and thread management for the Minecraft client environment.
overview: The Profile class provides client-specific profile management capabilities including Minecraft integration for error reporting, registration of client-specific events (player, world, UI), thread safety management for the Minecraft main thread, and formatting of script errors into clickable chat messages. It also coordinates UI updates when profiles are switched and registers client-specific libraries.

constructors.description: Internal constructor used by JsMacros to create the client profile instance. This constructor is not typically called directly by script writers.

methods.name: loadProfile
methods.description: Loads a profile by name, clearing the current event registry and loading all script triggers from the specified profile. This method extends the base implementation to also refresh the Macro Screen UI if it's currently open.

parameters.name: profileName
parameters.description: The name of the profile to load

methods.name: logError
methods.description: Handles error logging and display in the Minecraft client environment. This method formats exceptions into user-friendly chat messages with clickable links to open the problematic script files in the editor. It filters out ignored error types and unwraps runtime exceptions.

parameters.name: ex
parameters.description: The error/exception to log and display

methods.name: checkJoinedThreadStack
methods.description: Checks if the current thread is either the main Minecraft thread or in the joined thread stack. This is used to determine if the current execution context can safely join with other script contexts.

methods.name: initRegistries
methods.description: Initializes all client-specific events and libraries (FChat, FHud, FClient, FKeyBind, FPlayer, etc.). This method extends the base implementation to register Minecraft-client-specific functionality.
